metadata.title: CVE-2021-22095 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In Spring AMQP versions 2.2.0 - 2.2.19 and 2.3.0 - 2.3.11, the Spring AMQPMessage object, in its toString() method, will create a new String objectfrom the message body, regardless of its size. This can cause an OOM Errorwith a large message

criterions.comment: spring: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
